description: System-generated primary key for the warranty type record; used for internal identification and joins.
Business identifier for the warranty type (human-readable code), used by users and integrations; may include hierarchical or legacy codes.
Short name/description of the warranty type or the covered component.
Reference to the warranty provider/vendor organization (foreign key); likely points to a vendor table; confirm with SME.
Number of calendar days the warranty covers from the effective date; blank if not time-based.
Lookup to the meter basis used for coverage (e.g., miles, kilometers, engine hours); likely a code from a meter type table; confirm with SME.
Maximum allowed meter units under the warranty (miles/km/hours) based on meter_type; likely blank when not meter-based; confirm with SME.
Free-text notes about the warranty type, often including part numbers, pricing, or special terms.
System timestamp when the record was last modified.
Legacy timestamp of the last user-initiated change; likely overlaps with last_modified or user_date_modified; confirm with SME.
User account that originally created the warranty type record.
Timestamp when the record was originally created.
User account that last modified the record.
Timestamp when the record was last modified by a user.
